_exec_summary.SummaryText:
As a joint venture of Dow Corning, Hemlock Semiconductor Corporation (www.hscpoly.com) subscribes to and fully supports the American Chemistry Council (ACC) Responsible CareA? initiative and the RC 14001 management standard.  Voluntarily participating in these programs is a part of our commitment to improve environmental, health, and safety performance.
The Hemlock, Michigan manufacturing facility has implemented a Risk Management Plan.  The facility maintains communication with the local community officials through its Community Advisory Panel (CAP) and other activities.

Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies

Hemlock Semiconductor Corporation uses policies and procedures to manage environmental, health, and safety performance.  The company has established a Code of Business Conduct to guide its employees.  In addition, the Hemlock facility has implemented safety and environmental management systems.

Facility overview and regulated substances

The Hemlock, Michigan facility manufactures solar and semiconductor grade silicon for use by solar cell and electronic device manufacturers. The following RMP-regulated chemicals are used in the manufacturing processes: 
    - Hydrogen Chloride
    - Dichlorosilane
    - Trichlorosilane
 
Accident prevention program

The facility uses a systematic approach to prevent accidental releases through; employee and contractor programs that include training, preventive maintenance, policies, procedures, safety reviews, change management procedures, investigations and audits.  
In addition, the facility has implemented chemical-specific accident prevention measures, including:
    - Use of nitrogen to inert storage tanks
    - Use of high-performance, corrosion-resistant materials
    - Continuous air monitoring at select locations
    - Automated emergency shutdown systems
    - Emergency hydrogen chloride scrubbers

Five-year accident history

The facility reports the following accidents in the previous five years.  Accidents are i

nvestigated and followed up.  In October 2009, at least one individual from the local community was exposed to hydrogen chloride vapors due to equipment failure during a process startup.

Emergency response program

The Hemlock Facility uses an Incident Command (IC) system for emergency planning and response activities.  The system is based on the National Incident Management System (NIMS) model, modified to fit the facilities organization and operations.  Emergency response plans are coordinated with the Saginaw County Local Emergency Planning Committee and various Saginaw County Emergency Response Agencies, including the Thomas Township Fire Department. The facility conducts periodic drills to train site and community emergency response personnel, and participates in community-wide drills.  The facility maintains an emergency phone line to provide important information during any community emergency.

Planned changes to improve safety

Hemlock Semiconductor Corporation strives to continuously improve its environmental, health, and safety performance through management system and equipment reliability improvements.  The facility uses a formalized project-oriented approach to improve performance.
